result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Domonique Sterling Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Domonique Sterling Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 42 days time served.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 11/4/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program at Alma Center.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any treatment recommended by the agent.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Domonique Sterling Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Victim Impact Statement
Received and Filed. Jury Instruction - Violation a Temporary Restraining Order or an Injunction

Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Sentence Credit

Defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Domonique Sterling Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper not in court, in custody. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with GM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Domonique Sterling Cooper in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Domonique Sterling Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
